answers.answer: PCOS is common cause in women infertility. its not necessary they can be in any form. its basically follicles filled with fluids which is known as cysts. even if they are scattered you still have PCOS. there are other symptoms as well such as overweight, diabetes, extra hair on face, irregular menstrual cycle. by looking at these symptoms and by doing U/S then doctors prescribe PCOS.If you are overweight dropping some will help alot.It cause an-ovulation(no ovulation) for which if you have no HSG they prescribe clomid etc to conceive.

question: I had an ultrasound last week and was diagnosed with polycystic ovaries. I've been doing some research however, and have noticed that polycystic ovaries are characterised with cysts on the outer part of the ovaries, almost like rows of cysts or a necklace. I remember that mine looked like they were all over the place, with no order at all.Is this possible?
title: Can polycystic ovaries look like this?
